ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned how to understand and work with diff poem structures. How to make my language more concise and imagery more playful.

I learned a lot about reading and writing poetry, which is exactly what the class is meant to do. I learned about new forms of poetry, improved my ability to interpret poetry, and worked on my writing skills.
Learned how to read and write poetry!
I developed an understanding of how to read and write poetry and learned about image, lineation, and fixed form.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: All strengths. No weaknesses. Loved the class and the format

Strengths: the class was super chill. It was such a nice time to have in the middle of my week. Professor Zarin is great and really makes the class a place you want to be.

Weaknesses: I dont really think there are any, but one thing I will say is that we didnt receive much feedback over the course of the semester. Ive never been in a class like that before, so it was definitely frustrating at times.
I think the course was great. I wish there were a place where the class could all submit and see poems (maybe a notion page!)

Great setup. Really fun, welcoming class environment and helpful assignments. I do wish Professor Zarin could've shown us more example poetry as opposed to having students select it, since sometimes our selections weren't that good.

I really enjoyed the structure of the course and the way the lessons were built around the poems that students brought in for the anthology every week. One possible improvement would be to move the imitation assignment earlier in the semester (since it seemed like a very impactful week for a lot of the students in the class).

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely yes if you enjoy exploring writing poetry
Yes!! It was such a great class, and Professor Zarin was wonderful! If you like reading and/or writing poetry, I would 100% recommend this class. It was my favorite class this semester.
Yes, definitely. I learned so much about writing poetry.
Yes! An awesome chance to learn to write poetry if you can get in.
I would definitely recommend this course to any student with an interest in poetry.
